item.title: Kara add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Kara add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I liked myths. They weren’t adult stories and they weren’t children’s stories. They were better than that. They just were. Adult stories never made sense, and they were so slow to start. They made me feel like there were secrets, Masonic, mythic secrets, to adulthood. Why didn’t adults want to read about Narnia, about secret islands and smugglers and dangerous fairies?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kara add a quote by Sean Stewart
item.description: "For long after guilty memories fade, the urge for penance lingers: strong and blind as the will to drink rain and grope for sunlight." -- Sean Stewart
